title: The Cat pounces on Prime Media stake amid Seven deal
text:
Antony Catalano has made a move to take a major shareholding in Prime Media as a potential roadblock to the regional broadcaster's merger with Seven West Media.

Mr Catalano, through a number of different entities, has revealed a 10.26 per cent stake in Prime. The entities include his private investment vehicle Kirant and his friend Alex Waislitz's Thorney Investment Group.

Former Domain chief executive Antony Catalano has pounced on 10 per cent of Prime. Wayne Taylor

Mr Catalano, Seven and Prime have been contacted for comment.

The former Domain chief executive bought regional publishing business Australian Community Media from Nine, publisher of The Australian Financial Review, in a deal worth $125 million which completed at the end of June.

Mr Catalano has expressed the desire to create a cross-platform media business in publishing, television and radio.
description: Antony Catalano has made a move to take a major shareholding in Prime Media as a potential roadblock to the regional broadcaster's merger with Seven West Media.
